Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002121
Reply.text: What to do with the blocker?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002123
Reply.text: Leave the blocker.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002122
Reply.text: Grab the blocker.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('FindSergoBody_quest'); TakeQuest('blocktaken_quest'); SetVar('Ending', 1); TActivate('Decision_cs'); AddQuestItem('quest_blockirator'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001567
Reply.text: Wait a second… You don't know who was supposed to bring him the blocker to the Sowth?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001568
Reply.text: Same here. I'd like to know that too.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001571
Reply.text: You're right — we should go back. But why would we need Mansur? He already screwed us over and walked away.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001572
Reply.text: You don't get it all. You weren't there when his sister died because of those madmen. He swore he'd leave the moment things got dangerous. Didn't like the timing either, but I get it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001573
Reply.text: Whatever you say, buddy...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001574
Reply.text: Let's move. Time to turn back.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N01
Reply.text: My people got here just in time. A few seconds later — and there'd be nothing left of you but ash.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N02
Reply.text: Who are you and why'd you help us?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N03
Reply.text: We help all who suffer. Anyone who comes here deserves royal treatment.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N04
Reply.text: You didn't answer my question.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N05
Reply.text: This place draws the bravest and smartest from all corners of the world… just to break them. I meet every traveler who comes through — and try to talk them out of going further.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N06
Reply.text: Our mission is to wipe out the madmen! We've come too far to stop now.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N07
Reply.text: You might go too far. Someone was supposed to end all this not long ago… and we never saw him again.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N08
Reply.text: We're not stopping! …Wait. What the hell is that giant thing? You telling me this is where it all went wrong?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N09
Reply.text: Now you're getting it.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N10
Reply.text: Can you tell me more about it?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N11
Reply.text: You won't understand until you see it with your own eyes… Keep going. We'll talk if you make it back.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_1_N12
Reply.text: Alright… [He said "if"?]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002175
Reply.text: You've returned… and this time, it's just you. Interesting.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002176
Reply.text: That's right. We found the blocker — so what do we do with it now?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002177
Reply.text: Do you have it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002178
Reply.text: Yeah, I've got it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002179
Reply.text: Let me take a look… Ah, there we go. The blocker's got some damage, but it's not serious.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002180
Reply.text: So you're saying things are gonna be okay?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002181
Reply.text: If I'm right — yeah, it should.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002182
Reply.text: And what if you're wrong?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002183
Reply.text: Then you'd better be ready for anything. It might do nothing — or make things worse. But hey, life's boring without a little risk.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002185
Reply.text: Nope, that's not gonna work. Foreigner had his own plan — and honestly, it sounds a hell of a lot better than yours.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002187
Reply.text: Very well. You fear the risk — I understand. But if another path has opened… then perhaps fate wants you to walk it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002188
Reply.text: Farewell. Don't think we'll meet again.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002184
Reply.text: Fine. Let's do this.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002186
Reply.text: Then approach the ship, but not too close — otherwise you won't make it and end up like all the others standing motionless around it ever since they got near. Turn on the blocker once you're behind them all, by pressing this button. After that, leave it there and walk away. The effect won't be instant — you'll have to wait.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N01
Reply.text: What strength of spirit! You resisted the voice of the heavens themselves!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N02
Reply.text: We haven't heard anything like that.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N03
Reply.text: So, we made the right choice. Few people can get close to the source and find the strength to return. We've been waiting for you for many years.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N04
Reply.text: Get to the point.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N05
Reply.text: You have to stop the madness that started many years ago.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N06
Reply.text: We're ready. But tell us — what's really going on here?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N07
Reply.text: Long ago, our world was whole — there were huge nations, cities packed with millions of people, machines that made decisions for us. Everything seemed simple and clear. But then, in a single moment, everything changed...

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N08
Reply.text: Machines that think? That's not gonna end well… So what actually happened?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N09
Reply.text: We saw it ourselves — an unidentified flying object was detected and shot down by the Space Defense Forces. My colleagues and I were sent to investigate this strange phenomenon. The situation was extremely tense: it was dangerous to be in that country at the time because of the ongoing war against terrorists. We worked fast, always feeling like intelligence agencies from major powers — and local guerrillas — were watching us.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N10
Reply.text: I don't get half of what you're saying… But from what I hear, the old world wasn't any better than the one we've got now.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N11
Reply.text: Maybe… I never really thought about it. When we finally got inside the ship — and make no mistake, that was a spaceship — we were on top of the world. The possibilities were endless: new medicines, ultra-strong materials, groundbreaking tech… But instead of miracles, we found only death. People crushed by machines, three of my colleagues took their own lives within two days. And then… the worst came when we opened that sealed chamber in the central compartment…

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N12
Reply.text: That was a huge mistake. How could you ignore such clear warnings? You've seen them with your very own eyes!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N13
Reply.text: We're scientists. We don't believe in omens or signs. Anyway, I'll go on. It looked like some kind of system, that had remained dormant before, activated. Something beyond belief happened… My colleagues… their bodies literally exploded… Then there was a Voice — in my mind. I passed out and woke up here, outside the camp. I called for help, but no one answered. The radio was silent. That's when I knew — something terrible had transpired.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N14
Reply.text: You scientists really did burn the world down, didn't you? All in the name of curiosity.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N15
Reply.text: Yes. That knowledge is eating me alive from the inside. I should be punished, but I don't feel pain. I can't even die! God knows how many times I've tried to end it all… It was horrible. I thought I was the last one left in the world. But when the first survivors started showing up, joy quickly turned into horror. People had changed. Just look at me — or at yourself. Or your companion! I'm afraid to even imagine what's hiding behind your masks.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N16
Reply.text: Are you serious right now? This mask is what keeps us alive in this hell!

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N17
Reply.text: You can say whatever you want. But the worst part is — that thing is still running even now, and the poison keeps leaking into the air.

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N18
Reply.text: So if we stop it, the air will clear up and people will go back to normal? Then why didn't you go back and shut it down yourself?

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N19
Reply.text: I can't get near it! And I can't leave either! I'm cursed to stay close to this damned machine forever. All I can do is beg those who come here to destroy this monstrosity. But no one's managed to do it yet…

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N20a
Reply.text: So what are we supposed to do now?...

Reply.name: r4m2_Bar_Scientist_2_N21a
Reply.text: I already told you about the one who was supposed to end this mess. But we never saw him again. Maybe some of you know the name Sergo.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001566
Reply.text: Exactly. About two decades ago, he was given a mission — to bring a blocker here from the Sowth, which can only be reached through the Desert of Death. According to what I know, he left to get it… and no one's seen him after this.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001577
Reply.text: Now it makes sense why he left without telling anyone… Everyone just thought he was heading out for another trading run.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001569
Reply.text: That's beyond me. I've told you everything I know.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001570
Reply.text: Looks like we should head back, find Mansur, and figure out the next move. What do you say?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001575
Reply.text: Good luck to you.

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N01
Reply.text: Èíîçåìåö! Òû íå ïîääàëñÿ âåëèêîìó çîâó, ïîýòîìó ÿ õî÷ó îòäàòü òåáå îäíó âåùü.

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N02
Reply.text: ×òî çà âåëèêèé çîâ? ×òî çà âåùü?

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N03
Reply.text: Ñêîðåé, ñêîðåé, îíè ñëåäÿò. Ýòî ïîñëåäíèé ýêçåìïëÿð êíèãè, â êîòîðîé ãîâîðèòñÿ î òîì, ÷òî ïðîèñõîäèò ñ íàøèì ìèðîì…

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_CrazyBook1_1_N04
Reply.text: Ñòîé, ñóìàñøåäøèé! Êóäà ïîáåæàë…

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001372
Reply.text: Hey Hamza! What can I do for you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001373
Reply.text: Greetings, Idris! We wanted to ask you about the madmen. We're trying to figure out… where exactly they're coming from.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001374
Reply.text: I'm afraid I can't help with that. Only the Buharas might've known — but no one's seen them in years. One day, they just packed up and left, without a word. Many have tried to find them since… all in vain. Who knows — maybe they left these lands long ago.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001375
Reply.text: So what do we do now?..

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001376
Reply.text: As far as I know, Akil's been looking into it lately. You should ask him — maybe he's got something to go on. By the way… what made you suddenly start digging into where those madmen came from?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001377
Reply.text: They hit Ghadad. Mansur's sister… didn't make it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001378
Reply.text: That's awful news… She was one of the last who truly knew our past. I'm sorry. Whatever you're planning — may you succeed. For her.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001379
Reply.text: Thank you. May Musiba's memory guide your path. Ride safe.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002085
Reply.text: So? How was the trip?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002086
Reply.text: I told my dad what went down back east and what we're planning next. He stood by me, no questions asked. But hey, where the hell is Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002087
Reply.text: His father took him off somewhere right before you got here. Seemed all worked up about something.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002088
Reply.text: Do you know where he took him?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002089
Reply.text: Somewhere in that direction. What's the big deal? Why are you so worked up?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002090
Reply.text: His father's one of the guys in charge of security around here. If something went down... No surprise he got all nervous.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002097
Reply.text: So what now? What are we doing next?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002098
Reply.text: We make a plan for heading into the Desert of Death and then we go find Sergo.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002099
Reply.text: What are we even looking for Sergo for? Honestly, I've almost forgotten why with all this mess…

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002100
Reply.text: He was supposed to deliver the blocker, but couldn't make it across the desert. At least that's how it should've gone.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002101
Reply.text: Wait, are you telling me we could go all that way and still not find him?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002102
Reply.text: We can't rule anything out, but we don't have a choice. We have to try. Something tells me this raid won't be the last.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002103
Reply.text: Fine, we'll try. But the desert's a mess — visibility's terrible. I barely found my way out here. How the hell are we supposed to know where to look?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002104
Reply.text: We'll search as long as it takes. So, just to be clear — the only thing that can stop us out there are the madmen, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002105
Reply.text: That's right.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002106
Reply.text: You got through that mess by yourself. Imagine what three of us can do. These freaks don't stand a chance.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002107
Reply.text: Yeah… you're right. But we still haven't really figured out our course of action once we're out there in the desert.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002108
Reply.text: You didn't exactly have time to study the terrain of the desert, I take it?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002109
Reply.text: Afraid so. I'll say it again — the visibility out there is terrible. I could barely see past my own truck. And there's wreckage everywhere — almost ran into a couple of them while trying to get through.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002110
Reply.text: Well then, looks like we'll have to improvise — again. Based on what you told us about the desert, we don't really have a choice.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002111
Reply.text: Yeah, not the best plan in the world… but I guess we can't do anything about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002112
Reply.text: Hey, Mansur, you've been quiet. What do you think?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002119
Reply.text: Let's do it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002120
Reply.text: Alright. Let's roll.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002190
Reply.text: So? How did it go?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002191
Reply.text: No way it's gonna work. He doesn't even trust his own plan. Let's just go to your Oracle instead.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002192
Reply.text: What exactly was he unsure about?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002193
Reply.text: He said the blocker has minor damage — but it could either do nothing… or make everything worse.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002194
Reply.text: Makes no sense. If it's just a scratch, why the hell's he panicking? Anyway… fine. If you say we go to the Oracle — then let's go.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002195
Reply.text: Let's roll.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002124
Reply.text: So… what's next?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002125
Reply.text: We've got the blocker. That means the next step is clear — find out how to use it. And for that, we talk to Vasily.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002126
Reply.text: You wanna go back there again? I've got a better idea.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002127
Reply.text: Alright, I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002128
Reply.text: There's a being in another region that calls itself the Oracle. I think it could help us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002129
Reply.text: You sure about that? Maybe we should talk to someone who actually knows what to do with the blocker?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002130
Reply.text: I'm sure. The Oracle must know the best way out of this.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002132
Reply.text: Fine. Let's go find this Oracle then.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002131
Reply.text: You go to your Oracle yourself. I'm heading to Vasily.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002139
Reply.text: Whatever you say, buddy. I'll be right here when you come back.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002133
Reply.text: So… what now? We don't have the blocker, we don't have a solid plan either. I've got an idea — but I'm not sure it'll work.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002134
Reply.text: I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002135
Reply.text: There's this being in another region that calls itself the Oracle. I think it might be able to help us.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002136
Reply.text: And how exactly?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002137
Reply.text: I don't know. I'm not even sure this idea is solid… but right now, it's probably our only shot.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002138
Reply.text: Fine. Let's go find this Oracle then.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001588
Reply.text: Yeah, I delivered a package to Sergo not that long ago. He said it would be his last trip to these lands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001589
Reply.text: Ah… that's why you were asking about who was meant to bring him the blocker.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001590
Reply.text: Exactly. I still have this feeling like I was the one who delivered the blocker to him — though I can't be sure. Still… something just doesn't sit right.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001591
Reply.text: Even if you did deliver the blocker to Sergo — what happened after that isn't on you. He's the one who didn't make it through.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001594
Reply.text: Yeah, I came through the Desert of Death to get here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001595
Reply.text: So how is it there? More dangerous than the place we just came from?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001596
Reply.text: Not as dangerous, but definitely not safe either. You still gotta be extremely careful out there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001597
Reply.text: I hear you. Mansur… after everything you've done, you still wanna head into the Desert of Death? You gonna run off again at the worst damn time?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001536
Reply.text: Death to the raiders!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001537
Reply.text: Wait, wait! We're not enemies — we helped you! Bukhara knows us, they can vouch for us!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001540
Reply.text: What do you mean?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001541
Reply.text: You're here to find the site of the Catastrophe, aren't you?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001542
Reply.text: I'm here to find the ones who destroyed my village — and make them pay. You'd better not be one of those madmen.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001543
Reply.text: Easy. We're not like that. Me and my friend have never even left these lands. My father always said it's just as dangerous to the west as it is to the east. You mentioned madmen… so you're looking for them, huh?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001545
Reply.text: Me and my friend too. That's why I said we share the same goal. How about we team up?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001546
Reply.text: I'm in.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001547
Reply.text: Damn it… those were Alpharan symbols on their rides. So what am I now… a traitor?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001553
Reply.text: What the hell are "jasus" and "kelb"? Never heard those words before.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001554
Reply.text: Jasus are spies. Kelb are dogs.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001560
Reply.text: I've got a device that can call in a ship. I'll use it to evacuate the Bukharans — somewhere where real people still live.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001561
Reply.text: Is that even possible?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001470
Reply.text: Ha-a-amza! Look who it is! What's up, buddy? Need something?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001471
Reply.text: Hey. What's all the commotion in town about? People say you know what's going on.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001472
Reply.text: Because of what happened with the attack on Ghadad, nobody dares to go to Khazif for oil anymore! “Too risky!” Our reserves are running dry — the local oil deposit has dried up years ago! No one knows what to do! Everyone's trying to find a driver in Alikham or even Ghadad itself, but so far? All we get are rejections!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001473
Reply.text: What if I do it? Or Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001474
Reply.text: No way, I can't let you two get involved — I've heard about your plan to take down the madmen once and for all. I'm fully behind you on that! I don't want helping us with the oil to get in the way of ridding us of this curse. And honestly? This job is dangerous enough as it is. You wouldn't even be driving your own truck — and believe me, a rig full of oil is like a beacon for raiders and madmen. They'll jump at the chance to hit it. That's why we're looking for someone with real experience.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001475
Reply.text: Look, one trip won't kill me. Mansur can drive my car, so that I ride along with someone watching my back...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002196
Reply.text: Wait a second — since you're so sure of yourself, we actually do have a vehicle for backup. It's way sturdier than the junk locals usually drive, so the risk's not as bad.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002197
Reply.text: If it doesn't take long to get ready, we're good to go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001476
Reply.text: Fine. Make it one run and that's it. We'll use that time to find a real driver. You've got something bigger on your hands. Talk to Mansur first — cause if he doesn't agree, I'm not letting you go solo.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001486
Reply.text: Did you talk to Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001487
Reply.text: Yeah, he agreed.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001488
Reply.text: Great. Grab the trucks from the outskirts of the city and head to Oilburg — it's right here on the map. Just say it's for Kef, and they'll load everything for you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001504
Reply.text: Hamza? You're back already? That was fast!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001505
Reply.text: Yeah, Mario, I'm back. Brought a full load of oil. How long will it last us?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001506
Reply.text: Great! Unfortunately, it won't last long — but I hope we'll find someone else to make the run for more oil.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001507
Reply.text: Looks like tough times are coming our way...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001508
Reply.text: Yeah… rough days ahead. I can feel it. Just hope it won't drag on. So, what's the plan?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001509
Reply.text: Need to talk to Mansur first. Seems like he's set on heading east. As for me… I need some time to think.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001510
Reply.text: Good luck out there… I know you've got what it takes.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001406
Reply.text: Who are you, and what do you want from us?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001407
Reply.text: I live here, my name's Hamza. I'd like to ask you about the madmen.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001408
Reply.text: What reason do we have to believe that all you want is just that?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001409
Reply.text: We want to figure out where these madmen are coming from, because they've been attacking us nonstop lately. Not long ago, they attacked the city where my friend Mansur lives, and his sister was killed in that attack.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001410
Reply.text: I'm really sorry to hear that… Alright, I'll tell you what I know. Many years ago, the world went through a major upheaval. After that, we managed to rebuild and start over with a clean slate. But after some time, people began noticing strange and unexplainable changes in behavior — sudden shifts from joy to aggression. We couldn't figure out what was going on for a long time. Then one day, a calm and kind man suddenly attacked his own family. The next morning, he claimed he didn't remember anything, but no one believed him. He was sentenced to execution. And from that moment on, it became impossible to trust even those closest to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001411
Reply.text: So that's why you're hiding here?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001412
Reply.text: Exactly. After that incident, we decided it wasn’t safe to stay among the rest. Over time, these so-called madmen started forming groups and attacking each other. It didn’t really touch us, though — strong emotions like that are typical of the young, people like you. As for us, we were already too old for such feelings back then.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001413
Reply.text: Where did this catastrophe happen?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001420
Reply.text: Not far from our lands, further to the east. But please — don't go there! Whatever awaits you there is worse than death! Swear to me that you'll never go there!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001421
Reply.text: We swear. Can I ask one more question?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001422
Reply.text: Yes, you can.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001423
Reply.text: Have you been stuck here all this time?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001414
Reply.text: You could say that. We've got nowhere to run, so we're just waiting for them to find and kill us. And looks like it's gonna happen real soon.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001415
Reply.text: Don't worry, I won't tell anyone where you are. You've helped us a lot!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001416
Reply.text: You were searching for us, right? Don't tell me you just randomly showed up here hoping we'd be here.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001417
Reply.text: Yeah, we got a lead pointing here. But who says we actually found you, huh? We could just pretend we came up empty.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001418
Reply.text: Sure, you can say that — but nothing's stopping them from sending more people here anyway.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001419
Reply.text: Let's hope it works out the other way… Thanks again for helping us. Stay safe.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001538
Reply.text: He ain't lying. We met him not that long ago ourselves.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001539
Reply.text: See? Told you! We're not your enemies. More than that — looks like we're after the same thing.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001556
Reply.text: We won, but they'll be back. Soon. We're done. No strength left.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001557
Reply.text: So what do we do? We gotta figure something out. We can't just leave you to your fate!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001558
Reply.text: There's a harbor nearby, but there are no ships left. Although we checked all the equipment — it still works.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001559
Reply.text: Are you kidding me?! A port with no ships?! What the hell are we supposed to do with that?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001562
Reply.text: Yeah, it's hard to believe - but right now, we're out of options.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001563
Reply.text: If that's all we've got, then there's no point hanging around. Let's go!
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('GoToBuharaAgain_quest'); TakeQuest('EvacuateBuharas_quest'); TActivate('RemoveBuharaAndJrTeams_AfterFight'); TActivate('BuharaEvacuation'); TActivate('StopBattleMusic'); SetVar('BuharaSaveTalk', 3); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001388
Reply.text: Hamza, hey! Where did Akil run off to? I wanted to talk to him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001389
Reply.text: Dunno where Akil took off to — but answer me this: do you really know something about the Bukharans?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001390
Reply.text: Yeah, I've got a damn clue! But does Akil care? Nope — he's convinced I'm just talking trash. And he didn't even bother checking the places I suggested!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001391
Reply.text: Can you tell us where they might be? It would really help us out.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001392
Reply.text: I can tell you… but only if you do me a small favor. I'm not giving away something this valuable for free.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001393
Reply.text: No choice then — we're in. What do we need to do? [Just try pulling one of your tricks again… and this time, I won't let you walk away with it.]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001394
Reply.text: Not long ago, some thug robbed my wife! I want you to track him down and do whatever your heart desires. Just make sure he pays for what he did!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001395
Reply.text: And how exactly are we supposed to find him?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001396
Reply.text: She mentioned he was in a yellow Ural…

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001397
Reply.text: But there are tons of yellow Ural trucks in these lands — all of them full of thugs! How the hell are we supposed to find the right one?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001398
Reply.text: Hold on, let me finish. Don't cut in like that. His truck had something unique — a blue emblem with a wolf. Never saw anything like it since.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001399
Reply.text: A blue wolf emblem… that's not common. This could help us find him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001400
Reply.text: Go find him. Once you do and teach him a lesson — come ba... [Ha-a-amza!] Wait… isn't that your father calling? Anyway, return when it's done.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001401
Reply.text: See you soon, then! [Dad?! What does he want now?]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001402
Reply.text: How's it going with the job?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001403
Reply.text: We found him. And he paid for what he did.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001404
Reply.text: Perfect! Here's your reward from me. Now, as far as I know, the Bukharans might be at… Bloody hell! Looks like some other bastards have found you. And now they're coming for us!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001405
Reply.text: C'mon, faster — get to the truck!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001441
Reply.text: They're right at the city's edge — don't wait, strike as soon as you're out!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001442
Reply.text: Got it!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001425
Reply.text: Get out, you cursed Alwahads! This place is not for your kind! Not now, not ever!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001426
Reply.text: Sharaf, calm down. We took them all out. They're gone.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001427
Reply.text: Sorry, got carried away for a second. Where was I? Oh right — the Bukharans. They might be near the coast. If they're really there… better tell Akil yourself. Maybe he'll finally listen to you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001428
Reply.text: Wait a minute... How exactly do you know this?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001429
Reply.text: I've never met the Bukharans in person before — but I'm sure I'd recognize them. Once, I saw an old group photo from a Vahat festival. Among all those familiar faces, there was one man whose mask and clothes looked completely foreign — and far more worn out than the others. And just recently, I came across people like him on the coast. The moment they spotted me… they vanished. I didn't push it — pretended not to notice, and left.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001430
Reply.text: You sure they're still there? What if they already moved on to somewhere else?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001431
Reply.text: Where else would they go? The coast is the least-traveled place around here. No one dares to go there. Perfect spot for them.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001432
Reply.text: What if they tried to leave our lands?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001433
Reply.text: The Bukharans are wise — they'd never risk leaving. Crossing the Desert of Death and surviving is next to impossible… My friend Sergo did it more than once, but he never came back from his last trip…

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001434
Reply.text: But he did make it before! [Sergo… never came back?!]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001435
Reply.text: He always had guards with him! They sacrificed themselves for that chance.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001436
Reply.text: But the Bukharans aren't just one person.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001437
Reply.text: Hamza… do you really think they'd sacrifice themselves just to try and cross the Desert of Death into unknown lands?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001438
Reply.text: If I were them, I'd take that step too… because from what I've heard — they've got nothing left to lose.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001439
Reply.text: Don't waste time — head there now. And when you come back… tell me how it went.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001440
Reply.text: Alright, see you later.
Reply.scriptResult: CompleteQuest('KefDefend_quest'); TakeQuest('GoToBuhara_quest'); TActivate('GoToBuhara_tr'); TActivate('StopBattleMusic'); TActivate('RemoveSharaf'); EndConversation()

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001443
Reply.text: Took you long enough. So… was I right or what?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001445
Reply.text: Unfortunately… no. We didn't find them there.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001454
Reply.text: What a shame… Looks like I'll have to tell Akil to call off the expedition. While you were away, he finally listened to me and decided to send one out, saying, “Well, we've never checked that place before!” Arsa…

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001455
Reply.text: Wait, he's sending an expedition there?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001456
Reply.text: I just told you he did. So why the sudden panic? Hiding something?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001457
Reply.text: No, I'm just surprised he acted so fast. Expeditions like that aren't cheap — and they take a lot of time. That's all.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001458
Reply.text: Alright, if you say so. So… does that mean your investigation hit a dead end?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001459
Reply.text: Not exactly. Me and Mansur talked it over — we're thinking of heading further east to see what's out there.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001460
Reply.text: No one's gone that far east in a hundred years! I try not to believe rumors, but people say most of the madmen come from there. If that's true… you drive in, and you won't be driving out — not alive, at least.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001461
Reply.text: You said the same about the Desert of Death…

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001462
Reply.text: Crossing the Desert of Death is one thing. But stepping into the land that still turns people mad? That's suicide. The Desert's only dangerous because of the madmen already out there. And from what I've heard… there are far more of them to the east. What if you become one of them? Yeah, it's just a guess. But is this risk really worth it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001463
Reply.text: I'm grateful for your help. But it's not your call to make what's worth the risk and what's not. It's our mission — and we'll see it through to the end.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001464
Reply.text: Fine. Suit yourself. I'm out — got better things to do than argue. Just don't say I didn't warn you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001465
Reply.text: Wait — something's clearly happened since we left. Everyone's running around like crazy! What happened?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001466
Reply.text: Ask Mario about it. He knows everything. It's a long story, and I don't have time right now. Gotta run!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001467
Reply.text: Okay then...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001444
Reply.text: We found them there. Talked to them.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001446
Reply.text: What did they say?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001447
Reply.text: The madmen — they appear because of a disaster that happened long ago… out east. To be honest, I'm thinking of heading to those lands myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001448
Reply.text: You can't be serious! You think you'll just drive into hell and walk out?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001449
Reply.text: You said the same about the Desert of Death…

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001450
Reply.text: Crossing the Desert of Death is one thing. But stepping into the land that still turns people mad? That's suicide. The Desert's only dangerous because of the madmen already out there. And from what I've heard… there are far more of them to the east. What if you become one of them? Yeah, it's just a guess. But is this risk really worth it?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001451
Reply.text: I'm grateful for your help. But it's not your call to make what's worth the risk and what's not. It's our mission — and we'll see it through to the end.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001452
Reply.text: Fine. Suit yourself. I'm out — got better things to do than argue. Just don't say I didn't warn you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001453
Reply.text: Wait — something's clearly happened since we left. Everyone's running around like crazy! What happened?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001468
Reply.text: Ask Mario about it. He knows everything. It's a long story, and I don't have time right now. Gotta run!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001469
Reply.text: Okay then...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001380
Reply.text: Look who it is! Greetings, Hamza. Greetings, Mansur.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001381
Reply.text: Hey Akil. Idris said you've been looking for the Bukharans. We'd like to find them too. Got any leads?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001382
Reply.text: Nothing concrete to tell, I'm afraid. We've sent teams out again and again — all return with nothing. Hope is fading with every passing day...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001383
Reply.text: Idris said you were handling the search yourself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001384
Reply.text: No, I'm in charge of organizing the expeditions. Even joined a couple of them myself. No results at all. Not even a single lead!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001385
Reply.text: Ugh… Not what I was hoping to hear.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001386
Reply.text: Well, well. It’s Sharaf... Our favorite snake in human skin. Bet he’s here to share another one of his "leads" on the Bukharans. Stupid clown... Oh, almost forgot. Here’s what I owed you. Sorry I couldn’t help.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001387
Reply.text: [Sharaf? Knowing something useful? Is this real?!]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002212
Reply.text: Hamza, my dear boy! I've got good news! We found the Bukharans!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002213
Reply.text: I found them myself already. Turns out Sharaf was right about you agreeing to listen to him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002214
Reply.text: You already found them? And you didn't tell me? I actually listened to Sharaf — turns out we've never checked the coast at all!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002215
Reply.text: Didn't say anything because you seemed to already know everything back then. It was only after we came back that Sharaf told us you actually listened to him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002216
Reply.text: Ah, so that's how it is. Well, it doesn't matter now. Since we've found them… I think it's time to take them back where they belong.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002217
Reply.text: Akil, I don't think they'll agree to that.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002218
Reply.text: They don't get a say in the matter! The mission is clear — bring them back home or eliminate them... You heard nothing, understand?! Now go. Move!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002219
Reply.text: [Eliminate them?! A mission?! What the hell does that mean?! No way in hell I'm letting you do this...]

Reply.name: Adrenalin_NPC_dialog_1
Reply.text: Welcome, young ones! Don't miss your chance — we're holding Ural truck races today. And since you've already got yourselves these trucks, wouldn't make sense to miss it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001348
Reply.text: We came here for this.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001349
Reply.text: Great! Then you know the drill — 2,500 coins for the entry fee.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001424
Reply.text: I don't have the money… not yet.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001350
Reply.text: Of course.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001351
Reply.text: Need me to go over the rules, or are you already up to speed?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001353
Reply.text: Tell us the rules.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001358
Reply.text: The rules are simple: false start — you're out. Wreck your truck — you're out. Finish first — 20,000 coins. Second place — 10,000. Third — 5,000. One lap only — Urals aren't exactly built for speed like race cars. During the race, your vehicle will be equipped with a booster that can double its nominal speed. And for safety reasons — yours and everyone else's — all weapons must be removed before the start.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001359
Reply.text: Got it. When does the race start?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001360
Reply.text: Any minute now. Take your starting positions.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001361
Reply.text: Great, appreciate it! C'mon, Mansur — let's ride! Show these guys what a real driver looks like.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001352
Reply.text: We know the rules.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001354
Reply.text: Then tell me, just so I'm sure you're not bluffing.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002207
Reply.text: Uhh... False start costs you 20,000 coins... Third place means you lose...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002208
Reply.text: You know what — forget it. I can already tell you don't really know the rules. Let me spell it out: false start — you're out. Wreck your truck — you're out. First place gets 20 000. Second place — 10 000. Third — 5 000. One lap only — Urals aren't exactly race cars, if you catch my drift. During the race, your truck will be equipped with a speed booster that doubles its top speed. And yes — all weapons must be removed for safety. Yours and everyone else's.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002209
Reply.text: Got it. When does the race start?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002210
Reply.text: Any minute now. Take your positions.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002211
Reply.text: Perfect. Thanks!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001355
Reply.text: Sure. Wrong start — you're out. Wreck your truck — you're out. First place gets 20 000, second — 10 000, third — 5 000. One lap only.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001356
Reply.text: Perfect… but you missed something. Your truck will be equipped with a speed booster — doubles its top speed. And yes — all weapons must be removed for safety. Yours and everyone else's.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001357
Reply.text: No problem.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001490
Reply.text: Appreciate the cooperation. Now, if you'll follow me — it's time to take your starting positions. The race is about to kick off.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001491
Reply.text: Let's do this!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001653
Reply.text: Welcome, young ones! Don't miss your chance — we're holding Ural truck races today. And since you've already got yourselves these trucks, wouldn't make sense to miss it!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001654
Reply.text: My friend will be racing. I'm here just to watch.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001655
Reply.text: Alright, the stands are free for family and friends of the racers — so please, take your seat. Or… maybe you're feeling lucky and want to place a bet?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001657
Reply.text: Nah, I'll pass. I'll just watch from the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002083
Reply.text: Then please, take your seat.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002084
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001656
Reply.text: Yeah, I'll throw my coin in.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001658
Reply.text: So… who are you betting on? Your friend's in slot number 3. There are only four racers total. No official favorites — the rules are the same for all. It all comes down to skill.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001663
Reply.text: Number four — let's see what he's got.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001666
Reply.text: Understood. What is your bet amount?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001686
Reply.text: Actually… I'll pass. Changed my mind.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001706
Reply.text: You really wanna back out now? Double your coins if you guess right. Think again.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001714
Reply.text: Against my better judgment… let's roll the dice.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001754
Reply.text: Understood. What is your bet amount?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001762
Reply.text: Nope. I still don't want to place a bet.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001766
Reply.text: Got it. No bet — then please, take your seat in the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001770
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001758
Reply.text: 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002038
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 1000 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 2000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002048
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002049
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002050
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001757
Reply.text: 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002037
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 500 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002045
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002046
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002047
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001756
Reply.text: 250 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002036
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 250 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002042
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002043
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002044
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001755
Reply.text: 100 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002035
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 100 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 200 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002039
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002040
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002041
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001713
Reply.text: Yeah, I'm sure. I don't want to place a bet.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001718
Reply.text: Your call. But don't come crying later when your pick takes the trophy and you've got nothing to show for it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001726
Reply.text: Against my better judgment… let's roll the dice.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001818
Reply.text: Understood. What is your bet amount?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001823
Reply.text: Nope. I still don't want to place a bet.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001824
Reply.text: Got it. No bet — then please, take your seat in the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001825
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001822
Reply.text: 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002063
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 1000 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 2000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002064
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002065
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002066
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001821
Reply.text: 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002059
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 500 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002060
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002061
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002062
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001820
Reply.text: 250 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002055
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 250 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002056
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002057
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002058
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001819
Reply.text: 100 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002051
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 100 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 200 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002052
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002053
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002054
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001723
Reply.text: Man, I didn't come here to fight with you! I told you — no bet. Drop it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001730
Reply.text: Triple the reward if your guy takes it all. Still not interested?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001738
Reply.text: Don't waste your breath. I'm not betting — now or later.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001834
Reply.text: Got it. No bet — then please, take your seat in the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001835
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001737
Reply.text: …Triple the payout, huh? Fine. You've got yourself a gambler.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001826
Reply.text: Welcome to the game, buddy. How deep are you going?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001831
Reply.text: What, you believe that? Acting's my second talent. Still not putting a coin on the table.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001832
Reply.text: Wow, someone's got a temper. Alright alright — no bet, no problem. Take your spot in the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001833
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001830
Reply.text: 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002079
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 1000 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, your payout will be triple the original amount — 3000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002080
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002081
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002082
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001829
Reply.text: 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002075
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 500 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, your payout will be triple the original amount — 1500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002076
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002077
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002078
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001828
Reply.text: 250 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002071
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 250 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, your payout will be triple the original amount — 750 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002072
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002073
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002074
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001827

Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001871
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001742
Reply.text: 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001838
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 500 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 1000 coins.

Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 100 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 200 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001861
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001862
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001707
Reply.text: Yeah, I'm sure. I don't want to place a bet.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001715
Reply.text: Your call. But don't come crying later when your pick takes the trophy and you've got nothing to show for it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001720
Reply.text: Against my better judgment… let's roll the dice.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001771
Reply.text: Understood. What is your bet amount?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001776
Reply.text: Nope. I still don't want to place a bet.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001777
Reply.text: Got it. No bet — then please, take your seat in the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001778
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001775
Reply.text: 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001843
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 1000 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 2000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001841
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 250 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001875
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001876
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001877
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001772
Reply.text: 100 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001840
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 100 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 200 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001872
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001873
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001874
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001719
Reply.text: Man, I didn't come here to fight with you! I told you — no bet. Drop it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001727
Reply.text: Triple the reward if your guy takes it all. Still not interested?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001732
Reply.text: Don't waste your breath. I'm not betting — now or later.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001787
Reply.text: Got it. No bet — then please, take your seat in the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001788
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001731
Reply.text: …Triple the payout, huh? Fine. You've got yourself a gambler.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001779
Reply.text: Welcome to the game, buddy. How deep are you going?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001784
Reply.text: What, you believe that? Acting's my second talent. Still not putting a coin on the table.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001785
Reply.text: Wow, someone's got a temper. Alright alright — no bet, no problem. Take your spot in the stands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001786
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001783
Reply.text: 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001847
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 1000 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, your payout will be triple the original amount — 3000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001893
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001894
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001895
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001782
Reply.text: 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001846
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 500 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, your payout will be triple the original amount — 1500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001890
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001891
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 250 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, your payout will be triple the original amount — 750 coins.

Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 100 coins on truck number 4 has been accepted. If it wins, your payout will be triple the original amount — 300 coins.

Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001886
Reply.text: Thank you. Show 'em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001670
