Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 1000 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 2000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001857
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001858
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001859
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001669
Reply.text: 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001689
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 500 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 1000 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001854
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001855
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001856
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001668
Reply.text: 250 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001688
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 250 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 500 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001851
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001852
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001853
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001667
Reply.text: 100 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001687
Reply.text: Alright, your bet of 100 coins on truck number 1 has been accepted. If it wins, you'll receive double — 200 coins.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001848
Reply.text: I can head to the stands now, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001849
Reply.text: Head up and cheer ‘em on.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001850
Reply.text: Thank you. Show ‘em what you're made of, Mansur!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001334
Reply.text: Hamza?! Why are you suddenly showing up in your dad's truck? Did something happen to yours?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001335
Reply.text: Nah. My one's still good. Dad just gave me his truck — says he doesn't use it anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001336
Reply.text: And you just took it like that? What if he suddenly needs to go somewhere?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001337
Reply.text: If he really needs to go somewhere, then, like he said himself, it'll be easier for him to just ask someone for a ride.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001338
Reply.text: Hmm... Alright, fine. Let's go with that. Hey, since we both got Ural now — I was planning to join a race not far from here later on, they're doing it with Urals. Want to come along?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001339
Reply.text: What's the deal there?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001340
Reply.text: The winner gets 20,000 coins, second place takes 10,000, and third gets 5,000. But there's a 2,500 coin entry fee. And the race is just one lap. So… you in?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001650
Reply.text: Nah… sorry. Can't get myself excited about it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001651
Reply.text: C'mon, you can come just to cheer for me, at least. No pressure to race.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001652
Reply.text: Sure, why not? Let's go.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001341
Reply.text: Not bad. Alright, let's roll!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001362
Reply.text: What do you want from me?..

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001363
Reply.text: Mansur, I know it's hard for you now. But if we do nothing, the madmen will strike again — and next time, we might lose even more of our own.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001364
Reply.text: I don't know… My head's just not clear enough to make a call like that now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001365
Reply.text: Mansur, will you finally wake the hell up?! Are you even listening to me?! You think this was the last time those madmen are gonna come after us? Don't make me laugh — I know it's not over! We have to DO something! If we just sit here like cowards, they'll be back! And next time, anyone could die! You! Me! Anyone! You want that?! Is that what you want?! Then stay here and keep crying! But I'm not letting your sister's death be for nothing! We're doing this — if only to burn every last one of them down!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001366
Reply.text: I guess… you're right. I'm with you. But we should decide where to start our… “search.”

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001367
Reply.text: I think we should start by talking to the elders. Maybe they know something.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001368
Reply.text: Exactly! Idris lives in your city! He's the one who knows all the old stories. If anyone can point us in the right direction, it's him.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001369
Reply.text: You're right. Let's go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001370
Reply.text: Wait. I'll ride with you. Honestly, I don't trust myself to drive right now.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001371
Reply.text: No worries. Get in — we're wasting time!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001478
Reply.text: So what's going on? Did you find out what's happening?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001479
Reply.text: We've got a problem with the oil. Everyone's refusing to transport it after the recent attack on your town. They're saying it's too risky now. No one wants to do it!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001480
Reply.text: Let me guess — you went ahead and volunteered, didn't you?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001481
Reply.text: Exactly. But only once. Mario wouldn't let me near it after that — turns out he knows what we're up to and wants us focused on dealing with the madmen instead. I'll take another car, and you'll be in the one Mario's giving us for backup. We're likely going to get ambushed, so having backup is a must. Mario won't let me go alone — and honestly? I don't really want to either… What do you think?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002198
Reply.text: A car from Kef? Let's hope it doesn't fall apart before we even get there.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002199
Reply.text: Mario said it's far more solid than the trucks we've been using.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001482
Reply.text: Yeah… I think I'm steady enough now. I can drive.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001483
Reply.text: You really sure? We won't have a second to relax — not while we're carrying oil.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001484
Reply.text: You can count on me.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001485
Reply.text: Alright, get ready. I'll go tell Mario we're set.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001512
Reply.text: Hamza. We can't wait around anymore — time to take the next step.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001513
Reply.text: So you really want to head east after all, huh?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001514
Reply.text: Of course! And do we even have other options?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001515
Reply.text: Mansur, I don't know… I'm really questioning whether we should head east at all.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001516
Reply.text: So that's it? You trust Sharaf more than the people who've stood by you? Real nice.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001517
Reply.text: No. Not at all...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001518
Reply.text: So what then?! C'mon, Hamza! We started this — we gotta finish it! We already have a rough idea where those madmen are coming from. We just need to confirm it! If things get dangerous, we pull out — simple as that!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001519
Reply.text: Okay… okay, we'll do it. Just not right now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001520
Reply.text: Absolutely. But first, we need to tell our families. Go talk to your dad. You barely avoided a fight with him before because you didn't want to share our plans. Now's the time to fix that.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001521
Reply.text: Yeah, you're right. I'll do it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001548
Reply.text: Hamza, they look like jasus — I don't recognize a single face among them!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001549
Reply.text: Are you sure?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001550
Reply.text: You don't believe me? Go see for yourself then!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001551
Reply.text: Not a single face that I recognize… Could a madman really be hiding among us?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001552
Reply.text: Damn kelbs! Can't they just leave us alone?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001564
Reply.text: Name one person who isn't tired of them...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002091
Reply.text: HAMZA!! We might've just made a huge mess...

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002092
Reply.text: Huh? What do you mean?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002093
Reply.text: A massive convoy of vehicles is moving in on us from the east — looks like the madmen are getting serious this time! No way this is a coincidence. I think they're coming for revenge… for our little visit.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002094
Reply.text: You don't expect the madmen to be organized — but those sudden, well-planned attacks on cities? That's real. And it looks like we're next. What's our move?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002095
Reply.text: I don't know yet — my father didn't say how many are coming. It could be so many that even if everyone in the region stood against them… we wouldn't stand a chance.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002096
Reply.text: Looks like we're in deep trouble...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002113
Reply.text: I'm ready for any plan.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002114
Reply.text: You sure? Believe me, I still haven't gotten over what you pulled back at the madmen's base — and I'm afraid you'll bolt the moment things go south again.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002115
Reply.text: I said it before, and I mean it. That won't happen again. I'm in this until the end.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002116
Reply.text: Then what are we waiting for? Let's go.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002117
Reply.text: Let's do it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002118
Reply.text: Is everyone in?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002141
Reply.text: Hamza! Where the hell did you two disappear to?! I just stepped away to talk to my father — came back, and you were gone! And wait… where's the Foreigner himself?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002142
Reply.text: Long story, but I'll make it short. The Foreigner suggested heading to someone called the Oracle. He said this Oracle might know how to solve our problem…

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002143
Reply.text: So… did your Oracle help?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002144
Reply.text: Wait, I'm not done yet. We crossed the Desert of Death and reached the land where the Foreigner used to live. But the moment we drove a bit further, I started to feel sick. At one point, it got really bad — so we decided: he'd keep going, and I'd head back.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002145
Reply.text: And he just let you leave alone? Has he lost his mind?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002146
Reply.text: I told him I could get back on my own. Turns out I was right.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002147
Reply.text: And then what? He just kept going toward the Oracle? Alone?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002148
Reply.text: Yes. He went to him.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002149
Reply.text: Who even is this Oracle?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002150
Reply.text: All the Foreigner said was that it's some kind of machine.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002151
Reply.text: So a machine's gonna fix everything? Yeah, right — and I'm the King of the Desert.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002152
Reply.text: Cut the doubt, alright? Yeah, he wasn't sure — but he said it himself, “it might be our only chance.” And after all this time with him… I think he can be trusted.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002153
Reply.text: You trust him — I get it. But what's our move? Are we just supposed to wait here?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002154
Reply.text: Looks like it.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002155
Reply.text: What are you gonna do next?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002156
Reply.text: I'll go talk to my father — bring him up to speed on everything he missed. Then we wait. Nothing else we can do.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002157
Reply.text: Alright. See you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002158
Reply.text: See you.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001578
Reply.text: You're back!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001579
Reply.text: You… Rakshas! How dare you leave after we'd already started attacking the base?!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001580
Reply.text: I couldn't take the risk, Hamza! The fact that you came back alive and unharmed — that's pure luck! I told you I'd pull out if things got too dangerous. I could've left even when we first arrived and got ambushed! And don't tell me those madmen are patrolling the borders — they're just everywhere!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001581
Reply.text: Fine, I get your reasons. But you really did choose the worst possible moment to retreat.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001582
Reply.text: You're right, I messed up. Anyway — tell me what happened after I left.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001583
Reply.text: We fought the madmen at the base. Then the scientists showed up and pulled us out. The area beyond is safe now. We found the crash site — it's a huge flying saucer, surrounded by paralyzed people. It's… really creepy. And I also found out something about Sergo...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001584
Reply.text: And what did you find out about Sergo?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001585
Reply.text: He was given a mission decades ago — to deliver a certain "blocker" that was supposed to undo all the damage caused by the Catastrophe. He was meant to pick it up from the lands beyond the Desert of Death… but you know what happe...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001586
Reply.text: So what are we waiting for?! We need to head into the Desert of Death and try to find Sergo!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001587
Reply.text: Mansur, don't interrupt! You made me lose my whole line of thought! Oh yeah… right. He never came back from there. But the key thing is — Sergo isn't just connected to us two. He's known elsewhere too… Am I right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001592
Reply.text: Hamza's right. So what do we do now?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001593
Reply.text: We need to think this through and prepare for a possible trip into the Desert of Death. Foreigner, you came to us through the Desert of Death, right?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001598
Reply.text: No, this time is different. I spoke with my parents while you were gone — made them understand that if I leave again, I'll finish what I start. Last time, I ran on a promise. This time? No promises. Just vengeance!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001599
Reply.text: Glad to hear that mindset. I'll step out for a bit — going to meet with my father. Maybe use that time to think up a plan. Let's be smart about this.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001600
Reply.text: Alright, but hurry up — I can't wait to finish this once and for all!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001601
Reply.text: Mansur, take it easy. We need to think this through — don't wanna end up with your face in the sand. Alright, I'm off. Be back soon.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001302
Reply.text: You're back.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001303
Reply.text: Yes, father, what business did you have?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001304
Reply.text: Later. First, tell me - what happened to your car? It's clearly been in a fight. Did you run into the madmen after all?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001306
Reply.text: No, I just… lost control a little and hit the barrier… [Holy fountains, that sounded so stupid!]

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001307
Reply.text: Son. I can see the bullet marks. Why are you lying to me? You know better than that - lying never helps.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001309
Reply.text: Alright, fine… Yeah, we ran into a couple of madmen. Luckily, we managed to take them out.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001310
Reply.text: You could've just told me the truth from the start. And stop looking at me like you're scared or something. A father is supposed to worry about his son.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001317
Reply.text: Of course it's true. How else would it be?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001318
Reply.text: Alright then. So... what was it you wanted to show me, father?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001634
Reply.text: Son, I've been thinking… I've decided that maybe it's better if I give you my car. I don't need it anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001635
Reply.text: Father, are you sure about this? What if you need to go somewhere?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001636
Reply.text: Believe me, it'll be easier for me to just ask someone for a ride. Or better yet, I can always use yours. Although, if you want — you can sell it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001637
Reply.text: No, I won't sell my car — let it stay just in case. Father, you won't mind if I go meet Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001638
Reply.text: Of course. Just don't stay out too late, please.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001639
Reply.text: Okay, I'll see you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001305
Reply.text: I'll be honest — yeah, I did. And not just once.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001308
Reply.text: And you and Mansur just drove away from them?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001311
Reply.text: I doubt we would've made it home just by trying to get away from them...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001312
Reply.text: Glad you managed to handle them. And stop looking at me like that - so scared. I can't stay mad at you. A father is supposed to worry about his son.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001314
Reply.text: Of course it's true. How else would it be?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001315
Reply.text: Alright then. So… what was it you wanted to show me, father?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001628
Reply.text: Son, I've been thinking… I've decided that maybe it's better if I give you my car. I don't need it anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001629
Reply.text: Father, are you sure about this? What if you need to go somewhere?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001630
Reply.text: Believe me, it'll be easier for me to just ask someone for a ride. Or better yet, I can always use yours. Although, if you want — you can sell it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001631
Reply.text: No, I won't sell my car — let it stay just in case. Father, you won't mind if I go meet Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001632
Reply.text: Of course. Just don't stay out too late, please.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001633
Reply.text: Okay, I'll see you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001319
Reply.text: You're back.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001320
Reply.text: Yes, father, what business did you have?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001321
Reply.text: Wait. We'll get to business soon enough. How was the ride back? Didn't run into any madmen on the way?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001323
Reply.text: I'll be honest - yeah, we ran into a couple of them. But Mansur and I managed to fight them off, and I fixed the car myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001328
Reply.text: Glad you managed to handle them. And of course, I appreciate your honesty. But next time, try to call for help. Who knows — what if a whole pack of madmen attacks you, and you wouldn't be able to deal with them on your own? I really don't want you two playing heroes for no reason.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001329
Reply.text: I can't just lie to my own father to his face...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001330
Reply.text: Hamza, calm down. I'm not mad at you. You know how much I worry about you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001331
Reply.text: I know, father… Maybe we should get to the point?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001332
Reply.text: Of course. Son, I've been thinking… I've decided that maybe it's better if I give you my car. I don't need it anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001333
Reply.text: Father, are you sure about this? What if you need to go somewhere?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001646
Reply.text: Believe me, it'll be easier for me to just ask someone for a ride. Or better yet, I can always use yours. Although, if you want — you can sell it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001647
Reply.text: No, I won't sell my car — let it stay just in case. Father, you won't mind if I go meet Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001648
Reply.text: Of course. Just don't stay out too late, please.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001649
Reply.text: Okay, I'll see you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001322
Reply.text: Uh… no… We got back completely without trouble.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001324
Reply.text: You don't sound too sure about that. Are you really telling me you got back safe?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001326
Reply.text: Alright then, I'll trust you.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001327
Reply.text: Thank you, father. So… what did you want to show me?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001640
Reply.text: Son, I've been thinking… I've decided that maybe it's better if I give you my car. I don't need it anymore.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001641
Reply.text: Father, are you sure about this? What if you need to go somewhere?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001642
Reply.text: Believe me, it'll be easier for me to just ask someone for a ride. Or better yet, I can always use yours. Although, if you want — you can sell it.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001643
Reply.text: No, I won't sell my car — let it stay just in case. Father, you won't mind if I go meet Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001644
Reply.text: Of course. Just don't stay out too late, please.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001645
Reply.text: Okay, I'll see you later.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001493
Reply.text: Father, what's going on?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001494
Reply.text: What are you planning? I saw you speaking with Akil, then Sharaf.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001495
Reply.text: Father, I can't tell you anything yet, really.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001496
Reply.text: You can't tell me? You think I'm a fool?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001497
Reply.text: It's not that simple. Believe me, it's better for you not to know all the details right now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001498
Reply.text: Am I just supposed to sit here and wait for your mistakes to come back and hit us all?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001499
Reply.text: There are things better left in the dark — at least for now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001500
Reply.text: Secrets? You're talking about secrets? We don't have room for secrets, Hamza! You have to understand — your actions could put all of us in danger! Do you really think I can't connect the recent attack on Ghadad with your conversation with Akil, who's been searching for the elders who vanished long ago? And Sharaf! He's shouting every day that he knows where they are! And we both know what kind of man Sharaf is!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001501
Reply.text: Believe me, I know what I'm doing. Everything will be fine.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001502
Reply.text: Are you sure? Because all I see is trouble on the horizon. You need to be careful, Hamza.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001503
Reply.text: Thank you for understanding, father.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001522
Reply.text: Hamza, do you have a minute? I'd like to talk.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001523
Reply.text: Yeah, that's what I'm here for.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001524
Reply.text: Then speak.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001525
Reply.text: Father, I'm ready to tell you what's going on. The truth is, after what happened in Ghadad, Mansur and I decided to find out where the madmen are coming from — and how to destroy them. Right now, we're close to figuring out their origin. Obviously, the two of us alone won't be able to wipe them all out. But it's worth confirming our suspicions.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001526
Reply.text: And this is what you were hiding from me? Did you really think I wouldn't support you? Hamza, I'm proud of you — and of Mansur! Do what you must. When are you planning to leave?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001527
Reply.text: We need to go to Ghadad. Mansur needs to talk to his parents. We'll figure out the rest once we're there.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001528
Reply.text: Good luck to you both. If anything goes wrong, try to reach out — we'll help however we can.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001529
Reply.text: Thank you, father. I heard there's trouble with the oil supply — I brought some, but Mario said it won't last long.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001530
Reply.text: I just spoke to Mario. There's someone — a man who agreed to help us. He actually left to get the oil while he was waiting for you to come back. And he's not from here — he's from the outer lands.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001531
Reply.text: From the outer lands?! What if he's one of the madmen?

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001532
Reply.text: I asked him about that. He assured me he's fine.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001533
Reply.text: Alright then. Father, Mansur's probably been waiting long enough — we should get going.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001534
Reply.text: Good luck!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001535
Reply.text: See you later!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001602
Reply.text: Hamza, you're back!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001603
Reply.text: As you can see — I'm fine.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001604
Reply.text: I'm really glad to hear that. Come on, tell me how it went.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001605
Reply.text: Another time. It's a long story — I need to talk about something else.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001606
Reply.text: Alright, I'm listening.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001607
Reply.text: We're heading into the Desert of Death. We found out that Sergo was supposed to end this endless invasion of the madmen — but he never came back...

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001608
Reply.text: I know Sergo never came back. Lately, he's been going into the Desert of Death more and more often, always meeting with Sharaf, becoming more withdrawn and gloomy. All he ever talked about was how he had to complete his mission — no matter the cost. No man in that state could have defended himself. But how exactly was he supposed to stop the madmen?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001609
Reply.text: He was given orders decades ago — to pick up a blocker from the neighboring region on a certain day and bring it to the disaster site.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001610
Reply.text: Wait a second... How do you even know all this?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001611
Reply.text: We heard it from a scientist.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001612
Reply.text: What scientist? There are only madmen out there!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001613
Reply.text: No, those scientists were not one of the afflicted. They rescued us from the madmen's base in the middle of a battle.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001614
Reply.text: So you found their base? Then that explains why I saw Mansur's truck. At least the truck looked similar.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001615
Reply.text: Because that ahmak just took off in the middle of the fight!

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001616
Reply.text: Hamza! How many times have I told you not to talk like that in my presence?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001617
Reply.text: Sorry, father.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001618
Reply.text: Okay, let me piece this together. You found the madmen's base, decided to attack it, Mansur ran off, you were saved by some scientists who told you what Sergo was supposed to do — and now you want to go into the Desert of Death? But why?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001619
Reply.text: Yeah, that's exactly how it is. We want to find Sergo. Or whatever's left of him... And if he really was supposed to deliver the blocker, then we need to finish what he started.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001620
Reply.text: Turns out, you told me everything I wanted to know — and you said it'd take long to explain!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001621
Reply.text: Looks like that's the case.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001622
Reply.text: Aren't you afraid to go to the Desert of Death? What if it's even more dangerous out there?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001623
Reply.text: The Foreigner came to us straight through the Desert of Death. He says it's about the same out there as it is around here. Definitely not more dangerous.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001624
Reply.text: Then I guess I can wish you good luck. When are you heading out?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001625
Reply.text: Not sure yet — need to work out a solid plan. Hopefully, Mansur and the Foreigner are on it right now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_001626
Reply.text: Then get going — head over to them and work it out together! No point in hanging around here doing nothing. And if things go sideways, try to reach out. Same goes for when you find Sergo.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_001627
Reply.text: Alright. See you later, father.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002159
Reply.text: Hamza! Where have you been?! Mansur said you came back from the Desert, then he went to talk to his father for a bit — and when he got back, you were gone! Didn't I tell you to contact me once you found Sergo? Did you even find him? And where the hell did you go after coming back from the Desert of Death?!

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002160
Reply.text: Sorry, father, I totally forgot. Seriously. Let me tell you what happened.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002161
Reply.text: You'd better start talking.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002162
Reply.text: We found Sergo and his blocker. And then…

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002163
Reply.text: And how do you feel after all that?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002164
Reply.text: I was already feeling better back in the Desert of Death, so I'm okay now.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002165
Reply.text: So what do you need to do now?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002166
Reply.text: As far as I get it — just wait for news from the Foreigner.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002167
Reply.text: So… what then, if silence is all we get?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002200
Reply.text: I can always go back to Vasily and activate the blocker myself.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002201
Reply.text: You just said that Vasily wasn't even sure about his own plan.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002202
Reply.text: If activating the blocker is the only option left, it won't matter whether he's sure or not.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002203
Reply.text: Fair point. Let's hope for the best. Are you staying here or heading to Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002204
Reply.text: I'll stay here. It's been a while since I've been home, after all.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002205
Reply.text: Good choice. Come in, I'll bring you something in a sec.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002206
Reply.text: Thanks, father.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002168
Reply.text: We can always go back and get the blocker ourselves.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002169
Reply.text: So what if you take the blocker? What's your move after that?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002170
Reply.text: We'll go to the scientists — they should know what to do.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002171
Reply.text: Well then. Let's hope for the best. Are you staying here or heading to Mansur?

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002172
Reply.text: I'll stay here. It's been a while since I've been home, after all.

Reply.name: Dlg_npc_002173
Reply.text: Good choice. Come in, I'll bring you something in a sec.

Reply.name: Dlg_pl_002174
Reply.text: Thanks, father.

Reply.text: Ñìîòðè! Ýòî îíè!

Reply.text: ×òî ìû ñäåëàëè òåáå, ÷óæåçåìåö? Ïî÷åìó òû õî÷åøü íàøåé ñìåðòè?

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_pl_000008
Reply.text: Íåñêîëüêî ìåñÿöåâ íàçàä âû íàïàëè íà áåççàùèòíóþ äåðåâíþ è óáèëè âñåõ å¸ æèòåëåé.

Reply.name: r4_Dlg_npc_000009
Reply.text: Òû ÷òî, áðàò? Ìû íèêîãî íå òðîãàåì, ñðàæàåìñÿ ñ áåçóìöàìè, êîòîðûå ðàçðóøàþò íàøè ãîðîäà. Íàì íåò äåëà äî äàëåêèõ ñîñåäåé!

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_N01
Reply.text: Êàê ðåäêî â ïîñëåäíåå âðåìÿ ìû âèäèì ñâåæèå ëèöà â íàøèõ êðàÿõ! Ðàñïîëàãàéñÿ êàê äîìà, ÷óæåçåìåö!

Reply.name: Gadad_Bar_Customer1_01_P02
